thread.title: Fox’s Eric Bolling: Trump Press Office Shouldn’t Be Keeping Any News Outlets from Briefings
thread.title_full: Fox’s Eric Bolling: Trump Press Office Shouldn’t Be Keeping Any News Outlets from Briefings

author: Josh Feldman
title: Fox’s Eric Bolling: Trump Press Office Shouldn’t Be Keeping Any News Outlets from Briefings
text:
Fox’s Eric Bolling: Trump Press Office Shouldn’t Be Keeping Any News Outlets from Briefings by Josh Feldman | 7:20   
Fox News’ Eric Bolling is a fan of President Trump ‘s and not such a big fan of the mainstream media, but today on The Five he sided with the press’ complaints over certain news outlets being barred from the press gaggle today . 
Former White House Press Secretary Dana Perino took issue with the decision and said that a move like this is a serious “stumble” because it gets in the way of their message. 
Bolling doubted this came from Trump himself, but instead from the White House press office. And he even said that in this situation he has to “side with the media” in the belief that every single credentialed reporter should have access. 
Kimberly Guilfoyle pointed out this happened to Fox News during the Obama administration. 
Bolling concluded that Sean Spicer doesn’t have to call on every single reporter there, but at the very least all of them should be allowed in. 
Greg Gutfeld disagreed and said he didn’t quite understand the big deal here. 
Watch above, via Fox News. 
[ image via screengrab ]
